marketContext:
=== MARKET CONTEXT (Twelve Data - Last 24h) ===
RSI (1h): Current 56.1 | 12h Avg: 59.9
MACD (1h): MACD 823.79 | Signal 816.18 | Hist 7.61
Trend: BULLISH
ATR (1h): Current $1157 | 12h Avg: $1324

bugFixes.issue: quick-exit-breakeven logic is closing trades at losses (42 trades with only 33% win rate and many negative PnL). The condition checks for pnl >= 0.50 but the reason is 'quick-exit-breakeven' which suggests it should be closing at breakeven, not profit. Also missing a proper breakeven exit that's causing 13 trades with identical entry/exit prices.
bugFixes.reasoning: The quick-exit-breakeven reason is being used for trades that are actually losing money (33% win rate, -$0.786 PnL trades). The logic was checking pnl >= 0.50 but many trades closed with losses. Also, 13 trades had identical entry/exit prices indicating a bug where trades close immediately. Fixed by: 1) Lowering quick-exit threshold to $0.30 to cover fees, 2) Adding proper trailing stop breakeven logic, 3) Changing stale-exit to only trigger when slightly profitable, 4) Increasing stale timeout from 120s to 150s.

parameterChanges.reasoning: Stop losses are causing -$39.49 total PnL with avg loss of $1.58. In current high volatility market (BTC dropped from $72k to $64k in 2 days), tighter stops will reduce loss magnitude. The avg loss of $1.16 vs avg win of $1.10 shows stops are too wide.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: Reduce avg loss from $1.16 to ~$0.95, improving expectancy

parameterChanges.reasoning: Take-profit trades are 100% successful ($41 PnL from 31 trades = $1.32 avg). In current bearish/volatile market with RSI showing sell signals, smaller targets will increase hit rate and reduce exposure time. ATR is $1157 which supports smaller targets.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: Faster exits, higher win rate, reduced exposure to sudden drops

parameterChanges.reasoning: Average trade duration is 99 seconds. Many losing trades are held too long. In current volatile market with sudden drops, faster exits protect capital. Hours 10-14 UTC show 0-25% win rates - faster exits would limit damage.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: Reduce exposure time, limit losses during poor hours

parameterChanges.reasoning: Trades held longer than 2 minutes are showing poor performance. In current market with $2.6B daily liquidations and high volatility, shorter max trade time reduces risk of sudden adverse moves.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: Reduce tail risk from extended holds

parameterChanges.reasoning: Hours with high trade counts (Hour 8: 15 trades, Hour 9: 18 trades) show mixed results. Reducing max trades will force better signal quality. Current negative expectancy (-$0.121) means fewer trades = less losses.
Need stronger volume confirmation in current low-liquidity environment. Market data shows thinning liquidity amplifying volatility. Higher volume threshold will filter out weak signals.
Current min profit of $12 may be too high for quick scalps. With $30 collateral at 20x ($600 position), $8 profit = 1.33% which is achievable. This allows more profitable exits before reversals.

result.summary: Critical bug fix in recovery-manager.ts where quick-exit-breakeven was closing trades at losses (33% win rate). The logic allowed trades to close with negative PnL while labeled as 'breakeven'. Fixed by adding proper trailing stop logic and requiring minimum profit for quick exits. Parameter optimizations focus on tighter risk management for current bearish/volatile market: reduced stop loss (0.25% -> 0.20%), smaller profit targets (0.15% -> 0.12%), faster exits (120s -> 90s quick exit, 240s -> 180s max), and stricter volume confirmation (1.5x -> 1.8x). Hours 10-14 UTC show 0-25% win rates and should be monitored for potential trading hour restrictions.
result.marketAdaptation: BTC has dropped from $72k to $64k in recent days with record $3.2B realized losses. Market shows extreme fear sentiment, high volatility (19.24% estimated), and bearish technical signals across all timeframes. ETF outflows of $434M indicate institutional selling. Adaptations: 1) Tighter stops to limit downside in sudden drops, 2) Smaller profit targets for faster exits before reversals, 3) Higher volume requirements to filter weak signals in low liquidity, 4) Shorter trade durations to reduce exposure. The bullish RSI (56.1) from Twelve Data conflicts with broader bearish sentiment - suggests short-term bounces within downtrend, favoring quick scalps over extended holds.
warnings: Hours 10-14 UTC show 0-25% win rates with -$13.25 combined PnL - consider adding time-based trading restrictions
13 trades with identical entry/exit prices indicate potential execution or timing bug - monitor after fix
Current market showing extreme volatility with potential for further 10%+ drops - consider reducing position size
Short trades in bullish micro-trend (RSI 56.1) may face headwinds - monitor short win rate
Duplicate signal detection may be too loose - 2 trades often have same entry/exit prices within seconds

bugFixesApplied: src/risk/recovery-manager.ts: quick-exit-breakeven logic is closing trades at losses (42 trades with only 33% win rate and many negative PnL). The condition checks for pnl >= 0.50 but the reason is 'quick-exit-breakeven' which suggests it should be closing at breakeven, not profit. Also missing a proper breakeven exit that's causing 13 trades with identical entry/exit prices.
